title: William Shakespeare - 12 - The Winter's Tale - Caedmon 1961
description:
What is a man,
If his chief good andÃ‚Â marketÃ‚Â of his timeÃ‚Â 
Be but to sleep and feed? a beast, no more.
Sure, he that made us with such largeÃ‚Â discourse,Ã‚Â 
Looking before and after, gave us notÃ‚Â 
That capability and god-like reasonÃ‚Â 
ToÃ‚Â fustÃ‚Â in us unused. Now, whether it beÃ‚Â 
Bestial oblivion, or someÃ‚Â craven scruple
OfÃ‚Â thinking too precisely on theÃ‚Â event,
A thought which,Ã‚Â quarter'd, hath but one part wisdom
And ever three parts coward, I do not knowÃ‚Â 
Why yet I live to say 'This thing's to do;'
SithÃ‚Â I have cause and will and strength and meansÃ‚Â 
To do't.


...the final, fatal spur to action.

The BBC Radio Collection Hamlet with Michael Sheen. Superbly produced and excellently acted. The defect is that Shakespearean Tragedy requires great, and not merely 'excellent' acting. But judge for yourself...

(Kindly seed, and if you can't find a seed for any previous poetry torrent go to the folder 'Current Poetry Torrents' and follow the instructions on the pdf.)
